intro: Martynia unguis-diabolis, commonly known as the devil's claw, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking red, claw-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, yellow berries that contain toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in dry, sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions, though caution is advised due to its toxicity.
